intro: Liabum brachypus, commonly known as the short-stalked bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are simple and often submerged, while its flowers are small and usually pink or purple in color. Liabum brachypus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
